intro: Canthium confertum f. sumatranum, commonly known as the Sumatran spiny sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and palmate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Sumatra and Borneo. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
